release.action: The SqlFileImporter supports 'old' export files. Example: A table export was started and later, you added a new column to the table. Now if you want to import the data, the SqlFileImporter fills the missing columns of the export file with 'NULL'. The next feature supports redundant row separator. The table definition is the master of the import, so the SqlFileImporter ignores the redundant separators.
A new method for OraUtils#cleanUpSchema() to clean up all user objects.
Shortcut method for OracleTable to access primaryKey() and foreignKeys().
Update of groovy-all to version 1.7.0
Update of groovy-all to version 1.6.6
Update Assertion class to throw a more detailed assertion exception.
Add a method to find all user sequences (class OracleSequenceFinder).
Use Oracle JDBC driver version 11.1.
Update of ForeignKey finder method.
ForeignKey gets a #toString() method and the #copy() method gets a fix.
The Loader is able to identify java.lang.Number objects which are the source of a VARCHAR/CHAR column.
A new method #isString() for class OracleColumn.
The class SqlFileExporter ignore NULL values and print out an empty string instead of 'null'.
The class SqlFileImporter uses a commit limit counter. If the limit is reached, a commit will be executed to the database.
The property #referencedTableName of class ForeignKey was not set properly by OracleColumnFinder#getConstraint().
Add DBUnit Support. This is only a prototype implementation and may be change in further releases.
The Loader class in combination with the Data class supports DATE types.
The Loader class has some problems with 0 and NULL.
The Data object rows must not match all columns of a table. It is possible to define a Data object with a subset of defined table columns.
Two new methods: OraUtils#checkValidPackages(...) and OraUtils#checkValidProcedures(...).
TableColumn with new methods: #isNumber() and #isDate()
Loader and Data scripts for holding/importing table data.
Added a SQL*plus Wrapper.
First ideas collected and released.
